title: Gheimeh
description: A rich and aromatic Persian stew made with lamb or beef, split yellow peas, tomatoes, and dried limes, served with saffron rice and crispy potato fries.
ingredients: 1 cup Yellow Split Peas (soaked for 1 hour)
1/2 teaspoon Ground Dried Lime (or 2 whole dried limes (pierced))
1/2 teaspoon Saffron (dissolved in 2 tablespoons hot water)
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pot and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
Add garlic, turmeric, salt, black pepper, and cinnamon stick, then add the meat and brown on all sides.
Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the split peas, dried limes, and 4 cups of water.
Simmer for about 60 minutes until the meat and peas are tender.
Add saffron water, rose water, and crushed cardamom pods, then simmer for another 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, fry the potatoes in 1 tablespoon of oil until crispy and golden.
Serve Gheimeh with saffron rice and top with crispy fries.

title: Zereshk Polo ba Morgh
description: A classic Persian dish featuring saffron-infused rice with barberries and tender chicken.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon Saffron (dissolved in 2 tablespoons hot water)
instructions: Rinse and soak the rice for 30 minutes.
Fry onions in 2 tablespoons of oil until golden, then add minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add chicken, turmeric, salt, and pepper, then cook for 5 minutes until slightly browned.
Add tomato paste, sliced bell pepper, and cinnamon stick, stir for 2 minutes.
Pour in 4 cups of water, cover, and let the chicken simmer until tender (about 40 minutes).
Cook the rice, drain, and steam with saffron for 15 minutes.
Sauté barberries with butter and sugar for 2 minutes.
Serve rice topped with barberries alongside the chicken, removing the cinnamon stick before serving.

title: Joojeh Kebab
description: A traditional Persian grilled chicken kebab marinated in saffron, lemon juice, and yogurt, served with grilled tomatoes and saffron rice.
ingredients: 500g Chicken Breast or Thighs (cut into cubes)
1/2 teaspoon Saffron (dissolved in 2 tablespoons hot water)
Metal or Wooden Skewers (if wooden soak in water for 30 minutes)
instructions: In a bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, grated onion, garlic, saffron water, turmeric, salt, pepper, and olive oil.
Add chicken pieces to the marinade, mix well, cover, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours (preferably overnight).
Thread marinated chicken onto skewers, alternating with bell peppers.
Preheat a grill or barbecue to medium-high heat.
Grill skewers for about 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally until the chicken is fully cooked and slightly charred.
Grill cherry tomatoes on skewers for 5 minutes.
Serve Joojeh Kebab with saffron rice, grilled tomatoes, and fresh herbs.

title: Persian Macaroni
description: A Persian-style spaghetti dish with a rich, spiced meat sauce, cooked with a crispy tahdig layer at the bottom.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon Ground Dried Lime (or 1 whole dried lime (pierced))
instructions: Boil spaghetti in salted water until al dente, then drain and set aside.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
Add garlic, turmeric, salt, black pepper, cinnamon wood, and dried lime, then add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in the tomato paste and diced bell peppers, cooking for 5 minutes until fragrant.
Before adding the sauce to the spaghetti, remove the cinnamon wood, then add ground cinnamon and mix well.
In a pot, heat 1 tablespoon of oil and layer the thinly sliced potatoes at the bottom for tahdig.
Layer cooked spaghetti and meat sauce alternately in the pot.
Cover the pot and let it steam on low heat for 30 minutes to develop a crispy tahdig layer.
Flip the macaroni onto a plate to reveal the crispy potato tahdig and serve hot.

title: Lubia Polo
description: A fragrant Persian rice dish with green beans, spiced ground meat, and a crispy tahdig layer, served with yogurt or salad.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon Ground Dried Lime (or 1 whole dried lime (pierced))
1/2 teaspoon Saffron (dissolved in 2 tablespoons hot water)
instructions: Rinse and soak the rice in salted water for 30 minutes.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
Add garlic, turmeric, salt, black pepper, and cinnamon wood, then add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in the tomato paste, green beans, and dried lime, cooking for 5 minutes until fragrant.
Before layering the rice, remove the cinnamon wood, then add ground cinnamon and mix well.
Boil the soaked rice in salted water until slightly undercooked, then drain.
In a pot, heat 1 tablespoon of oil and layer the thinly sliced potatoes at the bottom for tahdig.
Layer rice and the meat-green bean mixture alternately in the pot.
Pour saffron water over the top, cover, and steam on low heat for 30 minutes.
Flip the Lubia Polo onto a plate to reveal the crispy potato tahdig and serve hot with yogurt or salad.

title: Ghormeh Sabzi
description: A rich and aromatic Persian herb stew made with beef or lamb, red kidney beans, dried limes, and a blend of sautéed herbs, served with saffron rice.
ingredients: 100g Fresh Fenugreek Leaves (or 1 tablespoon dried Fenugreek)
1 cup Red Kidney Beans (cooked or canned (rinsed))
1/2 teaspoon Saffron (dissolved in 2 tablespoons hot water)
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large pot and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
Add garlic, turmeric, salt, black pepper, cinnamon wood, and the cubed meat, then cook until browned.
Stir in the dried limes, paprika, and ground dried lime, cooking for another 2 minutes.
In a separate pan, sauté the chopped parsley, cilantro, and fenugreek leaves in 1 tablespoon of oil until fragrant.
Before adding the herbs to the stew, remove the cinnamon wood
Add the sautéed herbs, red kidney beans, and 4 cups of water to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low heat for about 90 minutes until the meat is tender.
Stir in saffron water, let it cook for another 10 minutes, then serve hot with saffron rice.

title: Fesenjoon
description: A luxurious Persian stew made with ground walnuts, pomegranate molasses, and tender chicken or duck, served with saffron rice.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon Saffron (dissolved in 2 tablespoons hot water)
instructions: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pot and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
Add garlic, turmeric, salt, black pepper, paprika, and cinnamon wood, then add the chicken or duck and brown on all sides.
Stir in the ground walnuts and let them toast for a few minutes to release their oils.
Add pomegranate molasses, sugar, dried lime, and 4 cups of water, stirring well.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer on low for about 90 minutes until the stew thickens and the meat is tender.
Before serving, remove the cinnamon wood, then add ground cinnamon and saffron water, stirring well.
Simmer for another 10 minutes to blend the flavours, then serve hot with saffron rice.

title: Pizza Makhsoos
description: A Persian-style special pizza topped with a combination of minced meat, chicken, sausage, mushrooms, and bell peppers, layered with mozzarella and Persian spices.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
Add garlic, turmeric, salt, black pepper, thyme, cinnamon wood, and ground beef, cooking until browned.
Add sliced mushrooms, cooking for another 3-4 minutes until they release their moisture and soften.
Stir in the cooked shredded chicken and sliced sausage, cooking for another 2 minutes.
Before assembling the pizza, remove the cinnamon wood, then add ground cinnamon and thyme, then mix well.
Roll out the pizza dough on a baking tray and spread pizza sauce evenly over it.
Sprinkle a layer of mozzarella cheese, then evenly distribute the cooked meat mixture.
Top with bell peppers, olives, corn, jalapeños, and sliced onions with extra cheese.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle oregano and thyme for extra flavor.
Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes until the cheese is melted and golden.
Slice and serve hot with ketchup or garlic sauce.

title: Tahchin
description: A crispy and golden Persian saffron rice cake layered with marinated chicken, yogurt, and eggs, served with barberries or raisins and herbs.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon Saffron (dissolved in 2 tablespoons hot water)
instructions: Rinse and soak the rice in salted water for 30 minutes.
Boil the rice in salted water until slightly undercooked, then drain and set aside.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
Add garlic, turmeric, salt, black pepper, and cinnamon wood, then add the cooked shredded chicken and sauté for another 3 minutes.
Before layering, remove the cinnamon wood.
In a bowl, whisk together yogurt, egg yolks, saffron water, and melted butter.
Mix half of the rice with the yogurt mixture to form the golden tahdig layer.
Grease a baking dish or pot with butter and spread the saffron rice mixture evenly at the bottom.
Layer the cooked chicken over it, then cover with the remaining plain rice.
Cover and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 60 minutes, or cook on low heat on the stovetop for 45 minutes until crispy.
In a small pan, sauté barberries or raisins with 1 tablespoon of butter and sugar for 2 minutes.
Carefully flip the Tahchin onto a serving plate, garnish with barberries or raisins, and serve hot.

title: Kuku Sibzamini
description: A crispy Persian potato patty made with mashed potatoes, eggs, and spices, served as a side dish or sandwich filling.
instructions: Boil the potatoes until fully cooked, then peel and mash them while warm.
In a pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil and sauté the grated onion until softened.
Add garlic, turmeric, salt, black pepper, and paprika, stirring for 1-2 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine mashed potatoes, sautéed onions, dried mint, baking powder, and eggs. Mix well until smooth.
If using parsley, add it to the mixture for extra flavor.
Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Shape the potato mixture into small patties and fry for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden and crispy.
Remove and place on a paper towel to absorb excess oil.
Serve hot with fresh herbs, pickles, or in a sandwich with flatbread.

title: Baghali Polo ba Mahicheh
description: A classic Persian dish of saffron-infused rice with dill and fava beans, served with slow-cooked lamb shank.
ingredients: 1 cup Fresh Dill (chopped) or 2 tablespoons Dried Dill
1/2 teaspoon Saffron (dissolved in 2 tablespoons hot water)
instructions: Rinse and soak the rice in salted water for 30 minutes.
In a pot, heat 2 tablespoons of oil and sauté the chopped onions until golden.
Add garlic, turmeric, salt, black pepper, cinnamon wood, and lamb shanks, searing on all sides.
Pour in 4 cups of water, cover, and let simmer on low heat for about 2 hours until the meat is tender.
Before cooking the rice, remove the cinnamon wood and add ground dried lime if using.
Boil the soaked rice in salted water until slightly undercooked, then drain and set aside.
In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoon of butter or oil and layer thin potato slices (optional for tahdig).
Mix the rice with fava beans and chopped dill, then layer it over the tahdig.
Drizzle saffron water over the top, cover, and steam on low heat for 30-40 minutes.
Serve the Baghali Polo with the slow-cooked lamb shank on top, garnished with saffron rice and extra butter.

title: Kuku Sabzi
description: A flavorful Persian herb frittata packed with fresh greens and eggs, served with yogurt and bread.
ingredients: 1/2 cup Fresh Chives (chopped) or 1/4 cup Dried Chives
instructions: In a large bowl, mix chopped parsley, cilantro, dill, and chives.
Add grated onion, minced garlic, turmeric, salt, black pepper, and baking powder, mixing well.
Beat the eggs separately, then add them to the herb mixture, stirring until fully combined.
If using, fold in chopped walnuts and barberries for extra flavor.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Pour the mixture into the pan, spreading it evenly.
Cover and cook for about 10-15 minutes until the edges start to set.
Flip the kuku carefully and cook for another 10 minutes until fully cooked and golden.
Slice and serve warm with yogurt, pickles, or bread.

title: Albaloo Polo
description: A flavorful Persian rice dish made with sour cherries, saffron, and optionally served with meatballs or chicken.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon Saffron (dissolved in 2 tablespoons hot water)
instructions: Rinse and soak the rice in salted water for 30 minutes.
In a small saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon of butter and add the pitted sour cherries.
Sprinkle sugar over the cherries and let them cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes until they release their juices. Set aside.
If making meatballs, mix ground meat with grated onion, turmeric, salt, black pepper, cinnamon, and cardamom.
Shape into small meatballs and fry in 1 tablespoon of oil until golden and cooked through.
Boil the soaked rice in salted water until slightly undercooked, then drain and set aside.
In a pot, heat 1 tablespoon of butter or oil and layer thin potato slices (optional for tahdig).
Layer the rice with cooked sour cherries and their syrup, adding saffron water between layers.
Cover and steam on low heat for 30-40 minutes until fully cooked.
Before serving, gently mix the rice, then top with meatballs or saffron-infused chicken.
Drizzle with melted butter and serve hot with yogurt or fresh herbs.
